metadata.title: CVE-2023-24531 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Command go env is documented as outputting a shell script containing the Goenvironment. However, go env doesn't sanitize values, so executing itsoutput as a shell script can cause various bad bahaviors, includingexecuting arbitrary commands or inserting new environment variables. Thisissue is relatively minor because, in general, if an attacker can setarbitrary environment variables on a system, they have better attackvectors than making "go env" print them out.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24531` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.17 - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
golang-1.17-go - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
golang-1.17-src - 1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.17.13-3ubuntu1.2').
golang-1.18 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.20 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.21 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
